SENT.plain: Neutrophilic panniculitis associated with myelodysplastic syndromes is rare
We report a 59-year-old patient who initially was diagnosed with myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) and developed a sudden onset of widespread pustulosis and erythematous indurated papules
Examination of skin biopsies of a papule lesion showed dense neutrophilic infiltration limited to the subcutaneous tissue
The pustules and papules disappeared completely after treatment with systemic corticosteroids
To our knowledge, only one patient was identified by MEDLINE search of the English-language literature
